The example reads the contents of a text file named AboutAssets.txt. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Blazor-MAUI-Demos/Resources/Raw/AboutAssets.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: csharp CODE: ``` async Task LoadMauiAsset() { using var stream = await FileSystem.OpenAppPackageFileAsync("AboutAssets.txt"); using var reader = new StreamReader(stream); var contents = reader.ReadToEnd(); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining HTML Table Structure for Blazor Components Catalog DESCRIPTION: HTML table structure that organizes Syncfusion Blazor components into categories with documentation links. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Hello World in C# DESCRIPTION: A basic C# program that prints 'Hello, World' to the console. It demonstrates the use of the Main method as an entry point and the Console.WriteLine method for output. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Blazor-Server-Demos/wwwroot/data/word/markdown-to-word.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` using System; class Hello { static void Main() { Console.WriteLine("Hello, World"); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Hello World Program in C# DESCRIPTION: Basic C# program that demonstrates the minimal code needed to output 'Hello, World'. Shows usage of System namespace, class declaration, Main method as entry point, and Console.WriteLine for output. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Blazor-MAUI-Demos/wwwroot/data/word/markdown-to-word.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` using System; class Hello { static void Main() { Console.WriteLine("Hello, World"); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Hello World in C# DESCRIPTION: A basic C# program that demonstrates the structure of a C# application and outputs 'Hello, World' to the console. It introduces the use of namespaces, classes, and the Main method. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Common/wwwroot/data/word/markdown-to-word.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: C# CODE: ``` using System; class Hello { static void Main() { Console.WriteLine("Hello, World"); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating New Chapters in UTD Dissertation Format DESCRIPTION: Steps for creating chapters 3 and greater in a UTD dissertation document. These instructions ensure proper section breaks and automatic chapter numbering. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Blazor-Server-Demos/wwwroot/data/pdf/manual.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 1. move the cursor to a point immediately above the section break for the preceding chapter, but after any chapter text. 2. choose Insert->Break->Section Break Next page. This will create a new section for the next chapter. (If you are using my "normal.dot" file, I have an icon set up for this, so you can avoid going through the menu system. The icon looks like a page with two columns, and is right next to the "square root alpha" icon.) 3. with the cursor on the first line of the new section, simply set the style of that line to the style "Heading 1". This will automatically insert the word "CHAPTER X", where "X" stands for the next chapter number. Word will automatically calculate that number for you. 4. proceed as with the directions for chapters 1 and 2 above to create chapter titles, sub-headings, or chapter text as desired. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Chapters 3 and Greater in UTD Dissertation (Word) DESCRIPTION: Step-by-step instructions for creating new chapters in a UTD dissertation using Microsoft Word. This process ensures correct formatting and automatic chapter numbering. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Common/wwwroot/data/pdf/manual.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 1. move the cursor to a point immediately above the section break for the preceding chapter, but after any chapter text. 2. choose Insert->Break->Section Break Next page. This will create a new section for the next chapter. (If you are using my "normal.dot" file, I have an icon set up for this, so you can avoid going through the menu system. The icon looks like a page with two columns, and is right next to the "square root alpha" icon.) 3. with the cursor on the first line of the new section, simply set the style of that line to the style "Heading 1". This will automatically insert the word "CHAPTER X", where "X" stands for the next chapter number. Word will automatically calculate that number for you. 4. proceed as with the directions for chapters 1 and 2 above to create chapter titles, sub-headings, or chapter text as desired. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Subsequent Chapters in Word DESCRIPTION: Step-by-step instructions for creating new chapters (3 and above) in a Word document with proper formatting and numbering. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Blazor-MAUI-Demos/wwwroot/data/pdf/manual.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` 1. move the cursor to a point immediately above the section break for the preceding chapter, but after any chapter text. 2. choose Insert->Break->Section Break Next page. 3. with the cursor on the first line of the new section, simply set the style of that line to the style "Heading 1". This will automatically insert the word "CHAPTER X", where "X" stands for the next chapter number. Word will automatically calculate that number for you. 4. proceed as with the directions for chapters 1 and 2 above to create chapter titles, sub-headings, or chapter text as desired. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Figures with Captions in UTD Dissertation DESCRIPTION: Instructions for properly inserting figures with captions in a UTD dissertation. This approach uses frames to keep figures and captions together while ensuring captions are detected for the table of figures. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Blazor-Server-Demos/wwwroot/data/pdf/manual.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 1. create an empty frame where you want the figure to go. I suggest creating a new blank line to do this. Again, if you are using my "normal.dot" configuration file, you will find an "Insert frame" icon on the toolbar. It's about in the middle of the toolbar, three icons to the right of the "Spelling and Grammar" icon. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Inserting Figures with Captions in UTD Dissertation (Word) DESCRIPTION: Instructions for inserting figures with captions in a UTD dissertation using Microsoft Word. This method uses frames to keep figures and captions together while allowing automatic detection for the table of figures. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Common/wwwroot/data/pdf/manual.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` 1. create an empty frame where you want the figure to go. I suggest creating a new blank line to do this. Again, if you are using my "normal.dot" configuration file, you will find an "Insert frame" icon on the toolbar. It's about in the middle of the toolbar, three icons to the right of the "Spelling and Grammar" icon. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Figure Creation Steps in Word DESCRIPTION: Instructions for inserting figures with captions in Word documents using frames to maintain proper positioning and enable automatic figure detection. SOURCE: https://github.com/syncfusion/blazor-samples/blob/master/Blazor-MAUI-Demos/wwwroot/data/pdf/manual.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` 1. create an empty frame where you want the figure to go. It's about in the middle of the toolbar, three icons to the right of the "Spelling and Grammar" icon. ```
